text.0: strong pūṣans majesty is lauded evermore the glory of his lordly might is never faint his song of praise is never faint.
text.1: seeking felicity i laud him nigh to help the source of bliss.
text.2: who vigorous one hath drawn to him the hearts of all drawn them the vigorous one the god.
text.3: thee then o pūṣan like a swift one on his way i urge with lauds that thou mayst make the foemen flee drive camellike our foes afar.
text.4: as i a man call thee a god giver of bliss to be my friend.
text.5: so make our loudlychanted praises glorious in battles make them glorious.
text.6: thou pūṣan in whose friendship they who sing forth praise enjoy advantage even in wisdom through thy grace in wisdom even they are advanced.
text.7: so after this most recent course we come to thee with prayers for wealth.
text.8: not stirred to anger o wideruler come to us come thou to us in every fight.
text.9: not stirred to anger come freegiver nigh to us to take this gift of ours thou who hast goats for steeds goatborne their gift who long for fame.
text.10: so wonderworker may we turn thee hither with effectual lauds.
text.11: i slight thee not o pūṣan thou resplendent one thy friendship may not be despised.
